page.title: 02TOFTWOOD POPULATION
page.content: In 1086 when the Domesday Book was compiled, Westfield, then called Westfelda, was little more than a hamlet with one man, the abbot of Ely owning all the land. He also owned 16 unfree men and their families. From a hamlet with one landowner Westfield has grown slowly to a present population of 200. Toftwood, in comparison has grown from one house in an area of woodland in 1086, to become a present day suburb of Dereham with a population of over 5,000. Nearly all of this population growth has taken place since the 1960s as a result of the rapid expansion of the town. Almost all of the housing here is privately owned and reasonably priced and attracts first time buyers, people with young families and retired people.
